resources.string: Kanji (tip: to select and/or copy-paste just long-click the edit box. To search for a part of a word just select it and press search)
Reading (when searching, romaji is automatically translated to both hiragana and katakana)
Deletes all Aedict-downloaded files, including dictionaries
Warning: there is less than %d kb of free space on the sd card (%d kb). The download will most probably fail.
The %s dictionary is missing. Do you wish to download it now?
Dictionary data files are currently taking up to %d kb. Do you wish to clean the files?

http://code.google.com/p/aedict

Copyright (C) 2009 Martin Vyšný
GUI design: Mitchell Liam

Licensed under GPL3: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html

What's new: http://baka.sk/aedict/changes-report.html

References:
EDict: http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/edict.html
Lucene: http://lucene.apache.org/java/docs/
Kanji recognizer (C) by Todd David Rudick, http://www.cs.arizona.edu/projects/japan/JavaDict/
SKIP code system (C) by Jack Halpern
Stroke order diagrams (C) Jim Rose, http://www.kanjicafe.com
Verb inflection examples (C) by Tim R. Matheson, http://www.timwerx.net/language/jpverbs/
Which romanization to use, both for romaji input and for display
Please select the visual style of the kanji. Look at the kanji in question and decide if it can visually be divided as (choose the first that applies):
into left and right sides, such as: 行 引 相 時 八 噛
into top and bottom parts, such as: 学 見 京 字 分 二 春
into an enclosing structure and an internal structure, such as: 気 週 間 広 国 月 通
none of the above, such as: 下 西 士 自 中 事 火 女
has a horizontal line at the top (e.g. 下, 西)
has a horizontal line at the bottom (e.g. 士, 自).
has a vertical line through (e.g. 中, 事)
none of the above (e.g. 火, 女)
Count the strokes in the leftmost part and then the number of strokes left in the right part. For example, in kanji 引, leftmost part has three strokes, and the right half has one.
Count the strokes in the topmost part and then the number of strokes left in the lower part. For example, in kanji 春, topmost part has five strokes, and the lower half has four.
Count the strokes in the enclosing part and then the number of strokes left in the internal part. For example, in kanji 通, enclosing part has three strokes, and the internal part has seven.
Number of strokes in the leftmost part:
Number of strokes in the right part:
Number of strokes in the topmost part:
Number of strokes in the lower part:
Number of strokes in the enclosing part:
Number of strokes in the internal part:
Please count all the strokes in the character, and then choose the first from the options listed below:
Use given dictionary for search and translation
Translate japanese text. Copy-paste the text here (e.g. from a browser). Simple, stupid and slow :-)
Available dictionaries (click on the name to install)
Please note that you must use the proper stroke order and count, otherwise your kanji will not be recognized. Also it does not recognize hiragana nor katakana characters.
All introduction dialogs will be shown again

For full changelog please see http://baka.sk/aedict/changes-report.html

- AnyCut can now create shortcuts directly to KanjiPad, Skip Lookup, Kana Table and JLPT Quiz.
- SOD images are now enlarged on high-DPI phones.
- Added customizable categories to the Notepad
- GUI Overhaul (thanks to Mitchell Liam)
- Added ability to add given example entry to a notepad
- The dictionary downloader now runs in background
- A quiz showing the Notepad items can now be started.
- Bugfixes

Mama wa mise de _banana_ o kau.
Mom buys/will buy bananas at the store.
_Jimu_ wa manga o yomu.
Jim will read a comic book.
Ojii-san wa sugu kaeru.
Grandpa will return soon.
Watashi wa ringo o taberu.
I'll eat an apple.
_Naomi_ wa _terebi_ o miru.
Naomi will watch TV.

Mama wa mise de _banana_ o kaimasu.
Mom buys/will buy bananas at the store.
_jimu_ wa manga o yomimasu.
Jim will read a comic book.
Ojii-san wa sugu kaerimasu.
Grandpa will return soon.
Watashi wa ashita kimemasu.
I'll decide tomorrow.
Jerry wa sugu heya kara demasu.
Jerry will come out of the room soon.
Ayako wa mainichi _terebi_ o mimasu.
Ayako watches the TV every day.

Watashi wa kasa o kaimasen.
I'm not going to buy an umbrella.
Kare wa machimasen.
He won't wait.
Kimiko wa oosaka ni ikimasen.
Kimiko isn't going to Osaka.
Watashi wa ima tabemasen.
I'm not going to eat now.
Kanojo wa kasa o karimasen.
She isn't going to borrow an umbrella.

_jon_ wa Sendai ni ikimashita.
John went to Sendai.
Kodomotachi wa kouen de asobimashita.
The children played at the park.
Yoshi wa ringo o tabemashita.
Yoshi ate an apple.
Shizu wa manga o kaimashita.
Shizu bought a comic book.
_Bobbu_ wa sono eiga o mimashita.
Bob saw that movie.

_jon_ wa Sendai ni ikimasen deshita.
John didn't go to Sendai.
Kodomotachi wa kouen de asobimasen deshita.
The children didn't play at the park.
Yoshi wa ringo o tabemasen deshita.
Yoshi didn't eat an apple.

Watashi wa kasa o kaitai.
I want to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa asobitai.
The children want to play.
_Bobbu_ wa tenpura o tabetai desu.
Bob wants to eat tempura.
_Miki_ wa sono eiga o mitai desu.
Miki wants to see that movie.
Watakushi wa kasa o kaitakunai.
I don't want to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa asobitakunai.
The children don't want to play.
_Terebi_ o mitakereba, yuushoku o hayaku tabenasai.
If you want to watch TV, hurry and eat your dinner.
Shichiji no densha ni noritakereba, ashita hayaku okimashou.
If you want to make the 7:00 train, let's get up early tomorrow.

Ikimashou.
Let's go.
Tabemashou.
Let's eat.
Yasumimashou.
Let's take a break.
Watashi ga hakobimashou.
I'll carry this / these [for you].
Esa o agemashou.
(To a pet) Let's get you some food.
Anata no jitensha o naoshimashou.
I'll fix your bicycle. / I'll help you fix your bicycle.

Tabenasai!
Eat!
Minasai!
Look!
Yominasai!
Read it!
Iinasai!
Tell me!
Suwarinasai!
Sit down!
Koko ni kinasai!
Come here!

Watashi wa kasa o kai ni iku.
I'm going to go buy an umbrella.
Watashi wa kasa o kai ni ikimasu.
I'm going to go buy an umbrella.
Chuuka ryouri o tabe ni ikimashou.
Let's go out and eat Chinese food.
Watashi wa kouen ni asobi ni ikitai.
I want to go play in the park.

_Miki_ wa watashi no atarashii _pasokon_ o mi ni kuru.
Miki is coming over to see my new PC.
_Miki_ wa watashi no atarashii _pasokon_ o mi ni kimashita.
Miki came over to see my new PC.
_Robbu_ wa jitensha o kari ni kimasen deshita.
Rob didn't come to borrow the bicycle.
Asobi ni kite ne.
Come over for a visit, okay? (Asobi ni kuru is a set phrase used to invite someone "to come for a pleasure visit." You may hear it often, but don't take it literally. Most of the time it is just a polite nothing, made obvious by having no date or time attached to it.)
It is hard to do something.

Kono budou wa tabenikui.
These grapes are hard to eat.
Kono kanji wa yominikui.
These kanji are hard to read.
Sono tatemono wa minikui.
That building is hard to see. (Besides the converted verb minikui, which means "hard to see," there is also an adjective minikui meaning "ugly." Accordingly, the sentence sono tatemono wa minikui could also mean "that building is ugly." Be especially careful to make the intended meaning clear when using it to refer to people or their property.)
It is easy to do something.

Kono _pasokon_ wa tsukaiyasui.
This PC is easy to use.
Kanojo no namae wa oboeyasui.
Her name is easy to remember.
Kono kanji wa kakiyasui.
This kanji is easy to write.
I went too far doing something.

Kare wa itsumo nomisugiru.
He always drinks too much.
Kimiko wa tabesugimashita.
Kimiko ate too much.
Kodomotachi wa _terebi_ o misugiru.
The kids watch too much TV.
I did X while I was doing Y.

_Bobu_ wa hatarakinagara ongaku o kiku.
Bob listens to music while he works.
Kimiko wa benkyou shinagara _terebi_ o mimasen.
Kimiko doesn't watch TV while studying.
Hanashinagara sanpo shimashou.
Let's take a walk while we talk.

_Jon_ wa kasa o kawanai.
John isn't going to buy an umbrella.
_Jimu_ wa manga o yomanai.
Jim doesn't read comic books.
Ojii-san wa sugu kaeranai desu.
Grandpa isn't going to return soon.
Watashi wa _terebi_ o minai desu.
I'm not going to watch TV.
Sachiko wa konai.
Sachiko won't be coming.
I probably do not do something.

_Jon_ wa kasa o kawanai deshou.
John probably isn't going to buy an umbrella.
_Jimu_ wa manga o yomanai deshou.
Jim probably doesn't read comic books.
Yuki wa furanai deshou.
It probably won't snow.

Watashi wa _terebi_ o minakatta.
I didn't watch TV.
Sachiko wa konakatta.
Sachiko didn't come.
Ojii-san wa shinbun o yomitakunakatta.
Grandpa didn't want to read the newspaper.
If I do not do something

Ojii-san ga sugu kaeranakereba watashi wa _makudonarudo_ ni ikimasu.
If Grandpa doesn't return soon I'm going to McDonald's.
_Miki_ ga heya o tsukawanakereba Junko wa tsukaitai desu.
If Miki isn't going to use the room Junko wants to use it.
Naoko wa kasa o karinakereba koukai suru deshou.
If Naoko doesn't borrow an umbrella she'll probably regret it.
I have to do something (It won\'t go otherwise)

_Jimu_ wa ima kaeranakereba narimasen.
Jim has to return now.
_Raura_ wa kasa o kawanakereba narimasen.
Laura has to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa tabenakereba narimasen.
The children must eat.
_Jimu_ wa ima kaeranakereba naranai deshou.
Jim probably has to return now.
_Raura_ wa kasa o kawanakereba naranai deshou.
Laura probably needs to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa tabenakereba naranai deshou.
The children probably need to eat.

Obaa-san wa kodomotachi ni soto de asobaseru.
Grandma lets the children play outside.
Okaa-chan wa Kimiko ni kasa o kawaseru.
Mom will have Kimiko buy an umbrella.
Sensei wa gakusei ni mainichi shinbun o yomaseru.
The teacher makes the students read the newspaper every day.
Roku ji ni kodomotachi ni yuushoku o tabesaseru.
I'll have the kids eat dinner at 6:00.
_Jon_ ni raishuu made ni kimesaseru.
I'll have John decide by next week.
Kare ni ashita kosaseru.
I'll have him come tomorrow.
Otou-san wa _Bobu_ ni benkyou saseru.
Dad will make Bob study.
Kanojo ni saseru.
I'll have her do it.
Ritsuko wa Kumi ni _pen_ o kawasemashita.
Ritsuko had Kumi buy a pen.
Ojii-san wa kodomotachi ni ame o tabesasemasen.
Grandpa won't let the children eat candy.
Watashi wa Kenji ni eigo o benkyou sasetai desu.
I want to have Kenji study English.
_Jon_ ni mise ni ikasemashou.
Let's have John go to the store.
Kodomotachi ni _terebi_ o misemashou ka.
Shall we let the kids watch TV?
I did X without doing Y

Kare wa yuushoku o tabezu ni nemashita.
He went to bed without eating dinner.
Kyou Shizuka wa kyoukasho o motazu ni gakkou ni kimashita.
Today Shizuka came to school without her textbook.
_Bobu_ wa maemotte denwa sezu ni _Jon_ no ie ni ikimashita.
Bob went to John's house without calling first.

Raishuu watashi wa Okayama ni iku deshou.
I'll probably go to Okayama next week.
Kenji wa atarashii kuruma o kau deshou.
Kenji will probably buy a new car.
Ashita wa ame (ga furu) deshou.
It will probably rain tomorrow.
Oosaka ni iku deshou?
You're going to Osaka, aren't you? (Please note that ka is not added at the end - a rising intonation is used instead)
_Sue_ wa kuru deshou?
Sue's coming, isn't she?
Tomoka wa eigo no shukudai o suru deshou?
Tomoka will do her English homework, right?

Raishuu watashi wa Oosaka ni iku hazu desu.
I'm supposed to go to Osaka next week.
_Jon_ wa sugu kuru hazu.
John should be coming soon.
_Bobu_ mo ikitai hazu.
Bob will probably also want to go.

Kanojo ni denwa suru hou ga ii.
I/we should call her.
Watashitachi wa sukoshi yasumu hou ga ii.
We had better rest a little.
Anata wa motto nihongo o benkyou suru hou ga ii.
You should study Japanese more.
Kyou densha de iku hou ga ii.
It would be better to go by train today.
Raishuu suru hou ga ii.
It would be better to do it next week.
Ato de taberu hou ga ii.
It would be better to eat later.
Yakiniku no hou ga ii.
I'd rather have a barbeque.
Inu no hou ga ii.
I'd rather get a dog.
Hawaii no hou ga ii.
I'd rather go to Hawaii.
I don\'t know whether I do something or not.

Kare wa dekiru ka dou ka kikimashou.
I'll ask him whether or not he can do it.
Watashitachi wa iku ka dou ka mada wakarimasen.
I don't know if we are going yet.
Hideki wa ashita yasumu ka dou ka wakarimasu ka.
Do you know if Hideki has tomorrow off?

Watashi wa raishuu Oosaka ni iku kamo shiremasen.
Maybe I'll go to Osaka next week.
_Jakku_ mo kuru kamo shiremasen.
Jack may also come.
Ashita yuki ga furu kamo shiremasen.
It might snow tomorrow.
Ashita ame ga furu kamo shirenai.
It might rain tomorrow.
Konban watashitachi wa soto de taberu kamo shirenai.
We may eat out tonight.

Ame ga furu kara kasa o motte ikimashou.
Since it is going to rain, let's take umbrellas.
_Bessu_ wa itsumo okureru kara denwa suru.
Beth is always late, so I'll call her.
Kasa o motte ikimashou. Ame ga furu kara.
Let's take umbrellas since it's going to rain.
Watashi wa _Bessu_ ni denwa suru. Itsumo okureru kara.
I'll call Beth because she's always late.
Gyuunyuu ga nai kara mise ni ikimasu.
We don't have any milk, so I'm going to the store.
Jisho o kaitai kara honya ni ikimasu.
I'm going to the bookstore because I want to buy a dictionary.
Suzuki-san no ie ni ikitakunai! Kare wa itsumo iya na mono o tabesaseru kara.
I don't want to go to Mr. Suzuki's place because he always makes me eat nasty stuff.
Ongaku o kikimasu. _Terebi_ o mitakunai kara.
I'm going to listen to music because I don't want to watch TV.
Kenji wa _kanada_ no gakkou ni ikimashita kara eigo ga jouzu desu.
Kenji's English is good because he went to a Canadian school.

Kare wa nihongo o hanasu keredomo, heta desu.
He speaks Japanese, but he's not good at it.
Keiko wa _piano_ o yoku renshuu suru keredomo, jouzu ni narimasen.
Keiko practices the piano a lot, but she doesn't get any better.
_Jakku_ wa kenkou ni ki o tsukeru keredomo, yoku byouki shimasu.
Although Jack is careful about his health, he gets sick a lot.

Watashi wa nihongo o yomu koto ga dekimasu.
I can read Japanese.
Keiko wa _piano_ o hiku koto ga dekimasu.
Keiko can play the piano.
Ashita _Jakku_ wa Tokushima ni iku koto ga dekimasu.
Jack can go to Tokushima tomorrow.
Watashi wa _furansu_go o yomu koto ga dekimasen.
I can't read French.
_Bobbu_ wa Junko ni denwa suru koto ga dekimashita.
Bob was able to call Junko.
_Richarudo_ wa ika o taberu koto ga dekimasen deshita.
Richard couldn't eat the squid.
Boku wa jitensha ni noru koto ga dekiru!
(one boy to another) I can ride a bicycle!
_Furansu_go o nihongo ni honyaku dekimasu.
I can translate French into Japanese.
Kinou, _Jon_ wa benkyou dekimasen deshita.
John wasn't able to study yesterday.

Watashi wa tabun ashita kaimono ni iku koto ni shimasu.
I'll probably decide to go shopping tomorrow.
_Jonesu_ sensei wa ashita no suugaku no jugyou no junbi o suru koto ni shimashita.
Mr. Jones decided to prepare for tomorrow's math class.
Watashi wa mainichi nihongo o benkyou suru koto ni shimashita.
I've decided to study Japanese every day.

Yukiko ga kuru made taberu koto wa dekimasen.
We can't eat until Yukiko comes.
_Bobbu_ ga denwa suru made matanakereba narimasen.
We have to wait until Bob calls.
Shukudai ga owaru made _terebi_ o misemasen.
I won't let you watch TV until your homework is finished.

Taberu na!
Don't eat!
Suwaru na!
Don't sit down!
Koko ni kuru na!
Don't come here! / Stay away from here! / Stay away from me!
Terebi o miru na!
Don't watch TV!
Sawaru na!
Don't touch!
Enki suru na!
Don't put it off!
Shaberu na!
Don't talk!
Neru na!
Don't sleep!

Isogu nara, tsugi no densha ni noru koto ga dekiru yo.
If we hurry we'll be able to make the next train.
Dekakeru nara, kasa o motte ikinasai.
If you go out, take an umbrella.
Ame ga furu nara, shiai o enki shinakereba naranai.
If it rains we'll have to put off the game.
Tabako o suu nara, soto de suinasai.
If you're going to smoke, do it outside.
Kodomotachi wa ima sunakku o taberu nara, yuushoku o tabenai deshou.
If the kids eat a snack now, they probably won't eat dinner.

watashi ga noru densha
the train I'll take
kare ga iku tokoro
the place he'll go
kanojo no deru jikan
the time she'll leave
watashitachi ga au kyaku
the customer we'll meet

Kono tegami o okuru no ni ikura desu ka?
How much will it cost to send this letter?
Tokyo yuki no densha ni noru no ni asu hayaku okinakereba narimasen.
We'll have to get up early tomorrow in order to make the train for Tokyo.
Hitsuyou na kanji o subete oboeru no ni daibun jikan ga kakaru.
It takes quite a long time to learn all of the necessary kanji.

Yomu no wa tanoshii desu.
Reading is enjoyable.
Nihongo o hanasu no wa kantan desu.
Speaking Japanese is easy.
Hayaku okiru no wa tokidoki muzukashii desu.
Getting up early is sometimes difficult.
Kasei ni sumu no wa mada fukanou desu.
Living on Mars is not yet possible.
_Hawai_ ni iku no wa saikou desu!
Going to Hawaii is great!

Kyaku ga kuru node watashi wa ima deru koto ga dekimasen.
A guest is coming so I can't go out now.
Ashita hayaku okiru node hayaku neru.
I have to get up early tomorrow so I'm going to bed early.
Eiko wa eigo o hanasu koto ga dekiru node ii shigoto o mitsukeru deshou.
Since Eiko can speak English, she'll probably find a good job.

[Yamenasai] to iu noni, kanojo wa kikimasen.
Despite my telling her to stop, she won't listen.
Hayaku okita noni okureta.
I was late even though I got up early.

Hiru kara ame ga furu sou desu.
I hear it's going to rain in the afternoon.
Kayo wa raishuu kara resutoran de baito o hajimeru sou desu.
I heard that Kayo's going to start working part-time at a restaurant next week.
Takada-san wa yameru sou desu.
I heard that Mr. Takada's quitting.

Hiroko wa mensetsu o ukeru tame ni Oosaka ni ikimasu.
Hiroko's going to Osaka for an interview.
Nyuujouken o kau tame ni daibun machimashita.
I had to wait quite a while to buy tickets.
Nihongo o benkyou suru tame ni atarashii jisho o kaimashita.
I bought a new dictionary to study Japanese.

Massugu iku to Ritsurin Kouen ga miemasu.
If you go straight you'll see Ritsurin Park.
Natsu ni naru to kodomotachi wa umi ni ikitakunarimasu.
When summer comes the kids want to go to the beach.
Watashi wa soba o taberu to byouki ni naru.
I get sick whenever I eat buckwheat noodles.

_Bobbu_ wa goji ni kaeru to omoimasu.
I think Bob will come back at five o'clock.
Eiko wa eigo o hanasu koto ga dekiru to omoimasu.
I think Eiko can speak English.
Koji wa okureru to omoimasu.
I think Koji will be late.
Sasaki-san wa mou sugu kochira ni denwa suru to omou.
I think Ms. Sasaki will call us soon.
Ashita wa ame ga furu to omou.
I think it'll rain tomorrow.
Eiko wa eigo o hanasu koto ga dekiru to omoimasen.
I don't think Eiko can speak English.
Koji wa okureru to omoimasen deshita.
I didn't think that Koji would be late.
Kyou ame ga furu to omoimashita.
I thought it would rain today [and it did.]

Watashi wa sanji made ni kaeru tsumori.
I plan to be back by three o'clock.
Steve wa _kanada_ ni iku tsumori da to omou.
I think Steve plans to go to Canada.
Keiko wa Kyoto Daigaku ni hairu tsumori desu.
Keiko intends to go to Kyoto University.

_Mari_ wa ashita kuru you desu.
It seems that Mary will be coming tomorrow.
Sachiko wa _kanada_ ni iku you desu.
It looks like Sachiko is going to Canada.
_Ken_ wa _piano_ o hiku koto ga dekiru you desu.
It looks like Ken can play the piano.

Isogeba, tsugi no densha ni noru koto ga dekiru yo.
If we hurry we'll be able to make the next train.
Ame ga fureba, shiai o enki shinakereba naranai.
If it rains we'll have to put off the game.
Kodomotachi wa ima sunakku o tabereba, yuushoku o tabenai deshou.
If the kids eat a snack now, they probably won't eat dinner.
Kyouto ni ikeba?
Why don't you go to Kyoto?
Shichiji han ni dereba?
Why don't you leave at 7:30?
It would be good if X

Soto de asobeba ii.
It would be good if you played outside.
Ima benkyou sureba ii.
Now would be a good time to study.
Watashitachi wa karui shokuji o tabereba ii to omou.
I think it would be good if we ate a light meal.

Hachiji ni kureba yokatta.
We should have come at 8:00.
Kouen ni ikeba yokatta.
I wish we had gone to the park.
_Suteeki_ o chuumon sureba yokatta.
I wish I had ordered the steak.

Watashi wa nihongo o yomeru.
I can read Japanese.
Keiko wa _piano_ o hikeru.
Keiko can play the piano.
Ashita _Jakku_ wa Tokushima ni ikeru.
Jack can go to Tokushima tomorrow.
Keiko wa _piano_ o hikemasu.
Keiko can play the piano. [polite]
Keiko wa _baiorin_ o hikemasen.
Keiko can't play the violin.
_Jakku_ wa Tokushima ni ikemashita.
Jack was able to go to Tokushima.
Kare wa Oosaka ni ikemasen deshita.
He wasn't able to go to Osaka.
Kare wa raigetsu ikeru kamo shiremasen.
He might be able to go next month.

Ikou.
Let's go.
Tabeyou.
Let's eat.
Yasumou.
Let's take a break.

Kaimono ni ikou ka na.
I think I'll go shopping.
Kaimono ni ikou ka naa.
I wonder if I should go shopping.
_Terebi_ o miyou ka na.
Maybe I'll watch TV.
_Bobbu_ ni denwa shiyou ka naa.
I wonder if I should call Bob.
Kyou wa tenki ga ii kara, arukou ka na.
I think I'll walk today since the weather's nice.

_Jon_ wa koyou to suru to omou.
I think John will try to come.
Naoto wa hikouki o miyou to shimashita ga, miemasen deshita.
Naoto tried to see the airplane, but he couldn't.

Rokuji ni kite.
Come at six o'clock.
Matte.
Wait.
Douzo, tabete.
Go ahead and eat.
Koko ni kite.
Come here.
Kore o kiite.
Listen to this.
Kore o kitte.
Cut this.
_Terebi_ o minaide.
Don't watch the TV.
Ikanaide.
Don't go.

Douzo, tabete kudasai.
Go ahead, please eat.
Chotto matte kudasai.
Please wait a bit.
Rokuji ni kite kudasai.
Please come at six o'clock.
Rokuji ni kite kudasai.
Please come at six o'clock.
Rokuji ni kite kudasaru?
Will you please come at six o'clock? [plain]
Rokuji ni kite kudasaimasu ka.
Will you please come at six o'clock? [polite]
Rokuji ni kite kudasaimasen ka.
Won't you please come at six o'clock?
Let me do X for you.

Matte ageru.
I'll wait for you.
Ato de denwa shite ageru.
I'll call you later.
Tabetakunakereba, tabete ageru.
If you don't want to eat it, I'll eat it for you.
_Bobbu_ ni _pen_ o kashite agete.
Lend Bob your pen.
Shizuka no kutsu no himo o musunde agete.
Tie Shizuka's shoelaces.

_Bobbu_ ni kiite goran.
Ask Bob and see what he says.
Tabete goran.
Taste it and see if you like it.
Mite goran.
Take a look.
Sanae ni denwa shite goran.
Try calling Sanae.
Kare wa sanjuu hachi to kaite aru. Yonde goran nasai.
It says he's 38. Read it for yourself.
Tana no ue ni shio ga aru yo. Mite goran nasai.
There is some salt on the shelf. See for yourself.
Kouen no kouyou wa ima kirei yo. Itte goran nasai.
The autumn leaves in the park are beautiful now. Go and see for yourself.

Watashi wa koko ni iru.
I am here.
Watashi wa aruite iru.
I am walking.
Karera wa zasshi o yonde iru.
They are reading a magazine.
Watashitachi wa Takamatsu ni sunde iru.
We live in Takamatsu. [We are living in Takamatsu.]
Shizuko wa tabete iru.
Shizuko is eating.
Kanojo wa sushi o tabete iru.
She is eating sushi.
_Birru_ wa nihongo o benkyou shite iru.
Bill is studying Japanese.
Watashi wa shinbun o yonde imasu.
I'm reading the newspaper.
Kinou nete imashita.
Yesterday I slept all day. [Yesterday I was sleeping all day.]
Kare wa _furansu_go o benkyou shite imasen.
He's not studying French.
Kyou _terebi_ o mite imasen deshita.
I didn't watch TV today. [I wasn't watching TV today.]
Teikyou o shite iru ko wa _Bobbu_ no imouto desu.
The kid [who is] playing tennis is Bob's [younger] sister.
Sunahama de asonde iru inu wa boku no desu.
The dog [that's] playing on the beach is mine.
_Samu_ wa koko ni imasen.
Sam's not here.
Karera wa zasshi o yonde imasen.
They aren't reading a magazine.
Watashitachi wa Okayama ni sunde imasen.
We don't live in Okayama.
Watashi wa mada tabete inai.
I haven't eaten yet.
Seiko wa mada kaimono ni itte inai.
Seiko hasn't gone shopping yet.
Yumi ni mada denwa shite inai no?
Haven't you called Yumi yet?
_Jon_ wa _terebi_ o mite ita.
John was watching TV.
Karera wa zasshi o yonde ita.
They were reading a magazine.
_Birru_ wa benkyou shite imashita.
Bill was studying.

_Jonson_-san ni denwa shite itadakemasu ka.
Would you please call Mr. Johnson?
O-namae o oshiete itadakemasu ka.
May I please have your name?
Niji ni kite itadakemasu ka.
Would you please come at two o'clock?
Ashita watashi ni denwa shite itadakemasen ka.
Won't you please call me tomorrow?
Kono shorui o kinyuu shite itadakemasen deshou ka.
Could I possibly get you to fill out these forms?
Murai-san ni senshuu ginkou ni itte itadakimashita. Oboete imasen ka.
I had you [Murai-san] go to the bank for me last week. Don't you remember?

kaasan: Kimiko ni mise ni itte moraitai.
Mom: I want you [Kimiko] to go to the store for me.
Kimiko: Ima shukudai o shite iru. _Ken_ ni itte moratte.
Kimiko: I'm doing homework now. Get Ken to go.
Kaasan: Kimiko ni mise ni itte moraitai.
Mom: I want you [Kimiko] to go to the store for me.
Kimiko: Ima shukudai o shite iru. Ojii-chan ni itte moraimashou ka.
Kimiko: I'm doing homework now. Shall I get Grandpa to go?
Kaasan: _Ken_ ni itte moraou ka naa.
Mom: (not wanting to bother Grandpa) I wonder if I should get Ken to go.
Kimiko: Ken wa ima inai. Ojii-chan ni itte moraimasu.
Kimiko: (thinking that Grandpa needs to get out more) Ken's not here now. I'll get Grandpa to go.
Suzuki-san: Ginkou ni ikimashou ka.
Suzuki-san: Shall I go to the bank?
Tanaka-san: Murai-san ni itte moraimashita.
Tanaka-san: I had Ms. Murai go.

Tabete kara kaimono ni iku.
After I eat I'm going shopping.
_Jon_ wa shukudai o shite kara kuru.
John's coming over after he does his homework.
Naomi ga kaette kara tabemashou.
Let's eat after Naomi comes back.
Gakkou ga owatte kara yakyuu o yarou.
Let's play baseball after school.
Shigoto ga owatte kara eiga o mi ni ikimashou.
Let's go see a movie after work.

Rokuji ni kite kureru?
Will you please come at six?
Jitensha o kashite kureru?
Would you please loan me your bicycle?
Denwa bangou o oshiete kuremasu ka.
Will you please tell me your phone number?
Ritsuko wa heya o souji shite kuremashita.
Ritsuko kindly cleaned the room.
Kyuukei sasete kurenai ka.
Won't you please let me take a break?
Watashitachi to issho ni kite kurenai no.
Won't you please come with us?
Kite kure.
Please come here.
Matte kure.
Please wait.

_Ron_ wa sukoshi zutsu nihongo ga wakatte kimashita.
Little by little Ron came to understand Japanese.
_Doitsu_ no rekishi o benkyou shite kimashita.
I have been studying German history.
Tabete kita.
I ate before coming over.
Shirabete kuru.
I'll go check it [then come back].

_pasokon_ wa yasuku natte iku deshou.
PCs will most likely get less and less expensive.
Sono tame, _pasokon_ no shiyousha ga fuete iku to omou.
Because of that, I think that the number of PC users will increase.

Kono kanji o yonde miru.
I'll try to read these kanji.
Kono atarashii _pasokon_ o tsukatte miyou.
Let's give this new PC a try.
Sushi o tabete minai no?
Won't you try some sushi?
_Jon_ ni hanashite mimasu.
I'll try to talk to John.
Kare ni denwa shite mimashita ga, rusu deshita.
I tried calling him, but he wasn't in.
Can I do X? (Do I have a permission?)

Boku no _pasokon_ o tsukatte mo ii yo.
You can use my PC.
Gohan o tabete kara _terebi_ o mite mo ii.
You can watch TV after you've eaten your dinner.
Jisho o karite mo ii?
Can I borrow your dictionary?
Raishuu no getsuyoubi o yasunde mo yoroshii desu ka.
May I take off next Monday?
Kyou, hayaku kaette mo yoroshii.
You may go home early today.
Watashi no jisho o tsukatte ii yo.
Sure, you can use my dictionary.
Hai, _terebi_ mite ii yo.
Yeah, you can watch TV.

_Ron_ ni denwa shite oku.
I'll call Ron.
Mado o akete oku.
I'll open the window.
Kasa o katte okimasu.
I'm going to buy an umbrella.
Kanojo ni ki o tsukeru you ni itte okimasu.
I'll tell her to be careful.
Shukudai o shite okimashita.
I [went ahead and] did my homework.
To complete doing X / To do something unexpected / Something negative may happen

Shukudai o shite shimaimashou.
Let's finish up our homework.
Choushoku o tabete shimaimashita.
I've finished eating breakfast.
Heya o souji shite shimau hou ga ii yo.
You should finish cleaning up your room.
Kuruma o katte shimaimashita.
I bought a car.
_Bobbu_ wa ude no hone o orete shimaimashita.
Bob broke his arm.
Kanojo wa Oosaka ni itte shimaimashita.
She [up and] went to Osaka.
Watashi no fuku ga yogorete shimau!
My clothes'll get dirty!
Ah! Fuku ga yogorete shimaimashita.
Oh, no! My clothes got dirty.
Densha ni noriokurete shimau yo!
We'll miss the train!
Ah! Kippu o nakushite shimaimashita!
Oh, no! I lost my ticket!

Ima chuushoku o tabete wa ikaga desu ka.
How about having lunch now?
Ashita Ritsurin Kouen ni itte wa ikaga desu ka.
What do you think about going to Ritsurin Park tomorrow?
Atarashii _terebi_ o katte wa dou desu ka.
What do you say we buy a new TV?

Shashin o totte wa ikemasen.
You can't take pictures.
Okurete wa ikemasen yo.
Don't be late.
Boku no _pasokon_ o sawatte wa ikenai!
Don't touch my PC!
Ikenai! Joushaken o wasurete shimaimashita!
Oh, no! I forgot my ticket!
Ikenai! Kimiko wa kasa o motte iku no o wasuremashita!
Oh, no! Kimiko forgot to take her umbrella!
I did X, then Y, then Z

Shizu ni denwa shite, heya o katazukete, kaimono ni ikanakereba naranai.
I've got to call Shizu, straighten up the room, and go shopping.
Kesa watashi wa shichiji ni okite, gohan o tabete, hachiji ni ie o demashita.
This morning I got up at seven o'clock, ate breakfast, and left home at eight.

Watashi shita.
I did it.
Kami kitta.
I got a haircut.
O-hiru tabeta.
I ate lunch.
_Terebi_ mita.
I watched TV.
Hon yonda.
I read a book.
Boku no kingyo shinda.
My goldfish died.
Watashi ga karita kasa wa Kimiko no.
The umbrella I borrowed is Kimiko's.
Shinda kingyo wa, roku nen kan katta.
The goldfish that died I had six years.
_Joi_ ga yaita keeki wa oishikatta.
The cake Joy made was delicious.
Boku ga katta _pasokon_ wa, juu hachi man en deshita.
The PC I bought was one hundred eighty thousand yen.
_Bobbu_ ga benkyou shita koto wa totemo yakudatta.
The things Bob studied were very helpful.

Okaa-chan wa kaetta bakari.
Mom just got back.
Watashi wa tabeta bakari.
I just ate.
_Jon_ wa deta bakari.
John just left.
Kono heya o souji shita bakari.
I just cleaned this room.
Sono kasa o katta bakari.
I just bought that umbrella.

Tabete bakari.
All you ever do is eat.
Ano ko wa _terebi_ _geemu_ o yatte bakari.
All that kid does is play computer games.
Shizuka wa eigo o benkyou shite bakari.
All Shizuka ever does is study English.

Nihonshoku o tabeta koto ga aru?
Have you ever eaten Japanese food?
Hai, sushi to sukiyaki o tabeta koto ga aru.
Yes, I've eaten sushi and sukiyaki.
Tako wa tabeta koto ga aru?
Have you ever eaten octopus?
Iie, tabeta koto ga nai ga, tabete mitai.
No, I haven't, but I'd like to try it.
Okinawa ni itta koto ga arimasu ka.
Have you ever been to Okinawa?
Hai, arimasu. Nikai ikimashita.
Yes, I have. I've been twice.
Kono hon yonda koto aru?
Have you read this book?
Iie, mada yonde inai.
No, not yet. [No, I haven't read it yet.]

Dekaketara, _kouto_ ga hitsuyou ni naru deshou.
If you're going out, you'll probably need a coat.
Denwa shitara, kare wa kuru deshou.
If you telephone him, he'll probably come.
Ima kodomotachi wa sunakku o tabetara, o-hiru o tabenai deshou.
If the kids eat a snack now, they probably won't eat lunch.

Sachiko wa _kanada_ ni itta rashii.
I hear that Sachiko went to Canada.
_Bobbu_ wa daibun futotta rashii.
I hear that Bob has gained a lot of weight.
_Ken_ wa atarashii _pasokon_ o katta rashii.
I hear that Ken bought a new PC.

Kinou no ban watashi wa _terebi_ o mitari, ongaku o kiitari, shukudai o shitari shite imashita.
Last night I watched TV, listened to some music, and did some homework.
Watashi wa _terebi_ o mitari shite ita.
I watched TV and stuff.
Watashi wa manga o yondari shite, yuushoku o tabeta.
I read comics and stuff, then ate dinner.
_Jimu_ wa furui mono o kattari uttari suru.
Jim buys and sells old things.
Ashita watashi wa benkyou shitari, souji shitari, _terebi_ o mitari suru deshou.
Tomorrow I'll probably do some studying, some cleaning, and watch TV.
Kinou no ban watashi wa yuushoku o tabete kara _terebi_ o mite, ni jikan gurai ongaku o kiite, ichi ji made shukudai o shimashita.
Last night after dinner I watched TV, listened to music for about two hours, then did homework until one o'clock.
Kyou Sachiko wa heya o souji shitari kaimono ni ittari shite, chuushoku o tabete, hiru kara yuujin no ie ni ittari _piano_ o renshuu shitari shite, sore kara yuushoku o tsukutte kureta.
Today Sachiko cleaned her room and did some shopping, ate lunch, then in the afternoon went to a friend's house, practiced the piano and things, then she made dinner.
If I were to do X, ...

Ashita _Bobbu_ ga kita to shitara, watashi wa hontou ni komaru.
If Bob were to come tomorrow, I'd really be at a loss.
Gogo kara ame ga futta to shitara, dou shimashou ka.
Supposing it rains this afternoon; what shall we do?
Ima oyogi ni itta to shitara, tabun koukai suru deshou.
If you were to go swimming now, you'd probably regret it.
Even if X, you must remember that Y.

Ashita _Bobbu_ ga kita to shite mo, watashi wa asatte made au koto ga dekimasen.
Even if Bob were to come tomorrow, I wouldn't be able to see him until the day after tomorrow.
Anata wa supeingo o benkyou shita to shite mo, shigoto de tsukaenai deshou.
Even if you studied Spanish, you probably wouldn't be able to use it in your work.
Kenkou shokuhin o takusan tabeta to shite mo, undou shinakereba imi ga nai deshou.
Even if you were to eat lots of health food, it would be meaningless if you didn't exercise.

Setsumeisho o yonde mo, kono _sofuto_ ga wakarinikui.
Even if you read the manual, this software is hard to understand.
Kare wa ikura tabete mo, ippai ni naranai.
No matter how much he eats, he never gets full.

Watashi wa sore o yonda toki, totemo odorokimashita.
When I read that, I was very surprised.
Sore o kiita toki waratta.
I laughed when I heard that.
_Jon_ wa koketa toki zubon ga yabureta.
John's pants tore when he fell.

Watashi wa ima kaetta tokoro.
I just got back now.
Kodomotachi wa ima tabeta tokoro.
The kids just finished eating.
Kono heya o souji shita tokoro desu.
I just cleaned this room.
I was just about to do X.

Ima Sachiko ni denwa suru tokoro datta.
I was just about to call Sachiko.
Watashi no saifu o wasureru tokoro datta.
I almost forgot my wallet.
Please note that the conjugation is performed automatically and may produce weird results, especially with kuru/suru. Don't believe everything you see :-)
It seems that the dictionary files became corrupted. Please try to delete them and re-download them. Also please check your sd-card for errors.
nouns which may take the genitive case particle `no\'
noun or verb acting prenominally (other than the above)
Godan verb - uru old class verb (old form of Eru)
Ichidan verb - zuru verb - (alternative form of -jiru verbs)
noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
word usually written using kanji alone
word usually written using kana alone
If disabled, the results will be sorted based on the Lucene Boost function
If the Tanaka example dictionary is missing the kana reading, please try deleting the dictionaries and download them anew. Also please note that the kana reading may be inaccurate.
You can search further by clicking on the kanji, or the onyomi/kunyomi reading, or the english translation

Aedict is a Japanese translation tool based on Jim Breen's EDict dictionary. Tips:
 
- Some features are accessible by long-clicking an item 
- You can switch to romaji anytime, using menu 
- Requires SDCard for storing dictionaries 
- You can use Romaji for Japanese search 

Features:

- Automatic download of the indexed EDict/Kanjidic/Tanaka dictionaries 
- Once the dictionary is downloaded it works completely off-line 
- Kanjipad for drawing and searching kanji characters 
- Search kanji characters by radicals and stroke numbers 
- Shows a kanji analysis in a word 
- SKIP search (a search based on the kanji visual look) 
- Optionally shows romaji instead of hiragana/katakana 
- Search in Tanaka Example sentences 
- Verb deinflection (e.g. searching for あえない will find あう) 
- Kanji drawing order for more than 1500 kanjis 
- A basic sentence translation 
- Verb conjugations with example sentences 
- Integrates with Simeji 
- Simple JLPT quiz
